storyInfo: Goldenglow's in Caladon visiting old friends and has a lottery ticket boasting an 80% win rate. As she scratches it open, she promises herself nothing more than a scoop of ice cream if she wins...

attributes.text: Thank you for your bulk purchase of our 'Bright Future' silky smooth shampoo products.

We are excited to announce our new promotional campaign, featuring a grand prize of two thousand Victorian pounds. Your recent purchase qualifies you for entry, and we have included a ticket for our prize lottery. We encourage you to try your luck!
Should you be one of our fortunate winners, please visit our factory headquarters in Caladon to claim your prize.
Thank you for your continued support.

attributes.content: Hmm~hmmhmm♪
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Let's see... A ceiling star projector for Quercus, the wind chimes on the mailbox for Kazemaru...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I still need things for Grani, Haze, Skyfire... the Doctor, Amiya, and Dr. Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Better get moving if I want to squeeze in time to visit my mates. It's been a while since I've been back at Caladon, wonder how everyone's doing.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Then there's this ticket. Even the smallest prize is twenty pounds, and there's an 8% chance of getting that, apparently...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I can't believe you need to collect your prize in person! If I hadn't come back to visit, I would've missed the chance.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, it looks like the fancy ice cream shop over there's having some kind of promotion!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Gulps)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: My luck can't be that bad, can it? Let's wait until I get that twenty quid, then I can have a scoop. Just a scoop. That's all I need...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Alright, let's give it a scratch.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Twenty... Well, there it is. Wait, is that another zero at the end?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Two hundred... No, thousand...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Twenty thousand?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Twenty thousand?! The first prize?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Susie rubs her eyes, holding the ticket up to the light.
It says, plain as day: '20000 pounds: Congratulations on First Prize!'
Oh... Oh lord, this...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Lowers her voice) No way! (Flustered) Okay, calm down... This is a lot of money. I-I need to...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I need to get back to the office right away to find Bitter Root, then we'll head to the prize exchange straight after.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Though her mind urges her to return to the Rhodes Island office, her legs have a will of their own and lead her to the ice cream shop.
Welcome! We're having a big sale today! 20% off a scoop, 50% off two!
attributes.name: Ice Cream Seller

attributes.content: If I get two scoops... can I get different flavors?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Of course! If you'd like to try even more, then I'd say our variety bucket's your best value for money.
attributes.name: Ice Cream Seller

attributes.content: Nope, I'm done. This bucket's too much for me, the brain freeze won't stop.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Heheh...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Look, we confirmed it's real, so you can stop checking it and giggling.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: The shampoo factory says their finance's on leave until next month, so you've got until then to put together a proper plan for how to spend that much money.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: First, I'll send half of it home. Ten thousand pounds should be enough to buy a much bigger and prettier house. Then, whatever's left can go towards business...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hmm... Maybe I'll donate a bunch of hairdressing equipment to Rhodes Island? The kind that could give even Spot a haircut he likes in under ten minutes?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Burst out laughing)
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: How about putting yourself first? Ten thousand pounds is not that much for a company, but it's life-changing for a person.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Darn, the convoy's here...
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Forgot to tell you Susie, but I've to go on a trip. I'll be back next month, then we can go claim the prize together, yeah?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Where're you headed to next? The convoy might be able to give you a ride.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I was going to look for James and the others, so... maybe I should check the pubs?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Sure, though ever since the accident with the Green Spark, the Infected community's workers haven't had a pub to go to.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I've heard some pubs outside let them in on the down-low for an extra fee. I figure they'll drag you there to celebrate your return.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Just take care not to get exposed. Last time someone got found out as Infected, those lousy drunkards beat him half to death.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I won't. I'll make sure everyone else is careful, too.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: How much did you say that was again, Susie?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: (Whispers) Twenty thousand pounds.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Twenty thousand pounds?!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Shut up! Don't you think Sparky's got enough troubles without you opening your gob?!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: (Whispers) Sorry 'bout that...
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: (Whispers) Let's not chat about this here. It's too risky.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Speaking of which, didn't they pass a bill for improved treatment of Infected workers before I left?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The bill's all well and good, but it'll take more than a piece of paper to change things.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: If it could, we wouldn't have to sneak around just for a drink now, would we?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Ah!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I'm really sorry, mister, I didn't mean to—
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hold on, Susie. Is that... a knife in his hand?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: You bloody little... static freak!
attributes.name: Suspicious Man

attributes.content: Terribly sorry about all that. We've sent someone to chase the pickpocket.
attributes.name: Barkeep

attributes.content: Everyone gets a glass of our special, on the house. Please don't let his tomfoolery give you the wrong idea about our fine establishment.
attributes.name: Barkeep

attributes.content: Hold up a sec, I remember you. Ain't you the git who shakes down the Infected the hardest just for wantin' a pint? Didn't have enough on me last time, so you—
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Perish the thought, sir! Please don't joke about such things! How could you possibly be an Infected?
attributes.name: Barkeep

attributes.content: No one listens to the barman, but no one is avoiding the Infected like they usually do either.
Twenty thousand? You serious?
attributes.name: Whispering Voice

attributes.content: Hey, isn't that the girl who exposed Councilor Bishmer's scheme? Susie Glitter?
attributes.name: Whispering Voice

attributes.content: I've got a relative who won two hundred grand buying a terminal the other day! I heard they quit their jobs the very next day, then went to Siesta for some R&R...
attributes.name: Whispering Voice

attributes.content: Why else would the girl install some electric gadget to protect her wallet?
attributes.name: Whispering Voice

attributes.content: Hmph. That much money is wasted on the Infected anyway. If I had that kind of money...
attributes.name: Whispering Voice

attributes.content: We better get out of here.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Move!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: *yawn* Morning already... I sure had a lot of nightmares last night.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The ticket... Still here.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: That slip of the tongue back in the pub... I'm sure nobody believed us.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I still have plenty of time to think over how I want to spend this money.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Miss Glitter? Rhodes Island's Miss Susie Glitter? I've put your mail in the letterbox, do make sure to check it!
attributes.name: Messenger

attributes.content: Mail? For me?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, the mailman's gone. Let me see...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh my goodness! Why're there so many letters in there?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: And... they're all for me?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: 'Got a windfall burning a hole in your pocket? Leave it to the investing guru certified by the Duke of Gododdin himself to double your wealth...'
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: 'Dear Susie, I hail from Boschendal, just like you. I even held you when you were just a baby. You might not remember me, but...'
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: 'Please help us, Miss Glitter. Our stores in the Boil have been running at a loss year after year, but with a single investment from you...'
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I didn't realize I was quite so famous.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: 'To the Hero of the City, Miss Susie Glitter. I am glad to hear of your return to the city, for I am a great admirer of your bravery in standing up in the name of justice for the common man, and would like to invite you to my humble abode...'
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What is even happening...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Well, as long as I don't fall for any of that, I should be fine.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I can't let this money ruin my plans! Cheer up, Susie, there's still plenty of friends to see and gifts to pick out!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Wait, I should find somewhere safer to keep this ticket first.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: *sigh* It's already noon... What should I get Grani? Weapon maintenance lubricant?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Excuse me, would you happen to be Miss Susie Glitter?
attributes.name: Meticulous Man

attributes.content: You needn't be so on guard, we met once at the Green Spark.
attributes.name: Meticulous Man

attributes.content: That's a pub for the Infected. You sure you've been there before?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: This should do. Grani's sure to be happy with it.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Is that really you, Susie?! It must be! C'mere already, am I glad to finally meet you in person.
attributes.name: Overfamiliar Woman

attributes.content: Do I... know you?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No, but does it matter? We just need some time before we're the best of friends. Want a drink? My treat.
attributes.name: Overfamiliar Woman

attributes.content: No thank you.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Please, I've got four kids to feed, and the factory let me go just yesterday. I've got nothing...
attributes.name: Tear-Streaked Passerby

attributes.content: Here, five pounds. Please, just take it...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I should really get back to the office now. I think there are even more people coming my way...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: D-Did someone try to mess with the lock?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh no! Rhodes Island's medicines are in there too!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Phew... No one's come in, thank heavens.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I better keep the door shut tight!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Wh-Who's there?! D-Don't come in!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Susie, it's me, Bean.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Mr. Bean? Are you here to... ask for money as well?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Awkwardly clears throat) No, nothing of the sort.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Look, we're terribly sorry, Susie. I'm here to apologize on Stone's behalf too. We've caused nothing but trouble for you with our big mouths.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: No, it's okay, it wasn't on purpose.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Actually, I came here to...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Discuss something with you.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Now that you're well-off, we were wondering if... we could rebuild the Green Spark, right where it used to be.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I know we're asking too much and it's not our money to begin with. I... Just forget I said anything. Where's Bitter Root by the way?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: On a work trip.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Well, he better come back soon. I don't like how a young lady's alone with that much money on you.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Bah, what's the point of me going on about all this? Anyways, you get some rest now.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Mr. Bean, how much would it cost to rebuild the Green Spark?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Huh? Uh...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Let me see... The lot's still there, no extra cost for that. A hundred quid to the city council and we can start working.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Rebuilding the interior should be about... a thousand and five, maybe six hundred. Add in the council's cut and some odds and ends, and I reckon two thousand pounds should do. Shouldn't be any higher than that.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Look, Susie...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Well, go ahead and call the council, then.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: R-Really?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Of course. I'm doing alright for myself at Rhodes Island, so I think it's better I put all this money to good use helping everyone out before it turns my entire life upside down.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: 'All this money'? No way, surely we couldn't possibly need that much?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: It's fine, really. See the mailbox outside? It'll be much better than dealing with all these people from heaven-knows-where sending me letters.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Then, I'll go tell the lads the good news?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Yes! On the double!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Bitter Root! You're back!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I heard all about what happened. Who knew things could have taken such a turn in the two short weeks I was gone?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Oh, no need to sound so negative. I think it's all rather wonderful, really.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: James has been dropping by every day to give an update. Sounds like it'll be fully rebuilt in a few days.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Two thousand pounds, was it? Bean's estimate was pretty accurate. Low-ball, even.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Not like there's any more to give. I haven't cashed in the ticket yet, so all I had was that two thousand quid. It really did all go towards rebuilding the Green Spark. Not a single penny's gone towards wages.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Wages, huh... I don't think Bean ever brought the topic up with you. Is that really alright? You might have to take a big chunk out of the ten grand you left for yourself. Not sure how much'll be left after.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: It's fine. Everyone's been having a rough time, so it's the least I could do. If it wasn't rebuilding the pub, I'd still be helping them out some other way.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Paying them is the least I can do for their hard work, even if they're too embarrassed to bring it up.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Figuring that out yourself means you've got a good head on your shoulders.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Oh, right, the finance from that shampoo factory should be back from holiday, right? Can't take them longer than building a pub, can it?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: May I help you, sir...?
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: We're here to trade in this ticket.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Oh, a friend of Susie's, I see.
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Judging by the grins on your faces, you must have won big! Congratulations, second prize and two thousand pounds should keep you comfortable for quite some time, even if you splurge a bit!
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Two thousand pounds?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Right, two thousand Victorian pounds—
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Sorry, miss, but mind reading that ticket again? I think you forgot a zero.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Wait, what? What's it say?
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Twenty thousand pounds. First prize.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: First prize?!
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: That can't be right... Hold it up for me while I confirm it.
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Well, there's certainly nothing wrong with it. How peculiar...
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: What's going on here? What's all the commotion?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Sir, this young lady's won our first prize, but as I recall, someone redeemed first prize before I went on leave, no?
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Hmm? Mind if I see that ticket?
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: Th-This...
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: The other first prize ticket's over here... Why are there two tickets with identical numbers?
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: Well, this one's obviously a phony! Qu-Quick, call the police, and get these two scammers out of my sight at once!
attributes.name: Factory Director

attributes.content: With all due respect, sir, but what the hell are you talking about?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: He's right, sir. Miss Glitter here is an upstanding, honest soul. Why, she's even been named 'the City's Hero'! Why would she do such a thing?
attributes.name: Finance

attributes.content: The two sides stare daggers at one another, but before things can escalate any further, Susie begins to speak.
Why did it have to be like this... Why...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I... I can't pay their wages...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: She does not cry, but her helpless muttering is more heart-breaking than any sobbing or weeping.
Oh, hey! Bitter Root, Susie! Perfect timing—
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Bean, there's something I have to tell you and the others.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: What could be more important than this? There's just one last thing we have to do before the job's done: put the Green Spark's sign back up where it belongs!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Would you like to do the honors, Susie?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Susie...?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: N-No... I can't...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Why the sad look? Bad memories?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: No. I... I'm fine.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I'll hang it up, then! Everyone's been fighting over who gets to do it.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Susie follows Bean to the Green Spark's front door.

The arboretum and lighting store has been restored to the way it was before the fire, with one new addition. Tucked away in a corner of the pub is a mirror, a barber's chair and all sorts of hairdressing equipment.
The gilded lettering across the storefront glints and glimmers, and the entire store is awash with the smell of a newly furnished building.
Bean climbs up a ladder, gingerly hanging up the Green Spark's sign as applause and cheering break out all around him.
Here's to a bar that won't give us the stink eye! Three cheers for the Green Spark!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Hip hip, hooray!
attributes.name: Infected District Workers

attributes.content: Susie looks around the rebuilt arboretum and lighting store-slash-pub-slash-barbershop.
It should have been the start of a new life for her.
At the very least, its reconstruction could have provided some income for those who contributed.
But why, why did it always come to this?
Upon hearing the cheering crowd, she feels a lump in her throat and her vision begins to blur.
Susie, we know the place holds some bad memories for you, but...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Oh, come on now, Sparky, you're breaking my heart with your crying. What's the matter?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: The ticket... The head of the factory said it was fake, but it's not... The twenty thousand pounds, my savings, everyone's lives... *sob*...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The ticket? A fake?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: You were going to say something to Bean earlier, Bitter Root. What's going on here?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: The shampoo factory won't accept Susie's ticket. They say the first prize has already been claimed.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: What kind of game are they playing?!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: The lottery was obviously rigged, but the boss messed up and Susie ended up with the real first prize ticket. Now they're saying it was a printing error and won't give her a penny.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: They got some bloody stones on them. The 'Bright Future' factory, yeah? That's just to the south of the Infected block. Susie's been buying their product from the start, all because they said they'd support our community, no?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Is this the kind of 'support' their chief meant?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Let's go, boys! We're gonna have ourselves a chat!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Infected District Workers

attributes.content: Hold it, most of you are Infected. If you all head to the factory, wouldn't you...?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Not to worry. We'll be there with them.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: We're not looking to start a riot. We're just going to tell that director that if he doesn't honor Susie's ticket, none of us will be buying his product, and we'll go on strike too!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Caladon named her a Hero of the City, for crying out loud! How could they do this to someone like that?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Cheer up, Susie. Let's go give them a piece of our mind together!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Allow me to once again apologize to you, Miss Susie Glitter, and your concerned friends.
attributes.name: City Council Administrator

attributes.content: While this incident is suspicious, I'm afraid there's no direct evidence that the factory director has been involved in lottery fraud.
attributes.name: City Council Administrator

attributes.content: He has agreed to compensate Miss Glitter two thousand Victorian pounds, alongside two shipments of 'Bright Future' shampoo. Consider the matter settled. I ask all present to refrain from causing any further complications.
attributes.name: City Council Administrator

attributes.content: Hold on a sec, this isn't—
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: *sigh* Bollocks. Typical Infected discrimination. If it was one of those councilors bringing up the matter, he'd be going 'yes, milord' right away.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Stuff it. Talking about it won't change a thing.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: At least it's better than coming out empty-handed.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Here, this should be enough to pay off our tab.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Well... Now that that's all done and dusted, we should head back home now. Sorry, Susie, for making things harder on you.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: If anything comes up in the future, remember to give us a shout! I'll be the first one over!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Huh...? Ah!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Wait! James, Stone, Mr. Bean, everyone, wait!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Eh? What's the matter, something else on your mind?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Your wages...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Wages? Bean says he talked everything over with you that day.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: I was going to use a big chunk of that twenty grand to pay everyone for their time and effort. It was supposed to help improve your lives...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The payout's only two thousand pounds now, and I don't have any more savings on me, so all I can do is divide this up between you all—
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Wait, Susie, darling, I think you've got this all wrong.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Bean, what in the blazes did you tell her that day?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Uh, well, Susie told me 'I think it's better I put all this money to good use helping everyone out before it turns my entire life upside down', then I said 'Surely we couldn't possibly need that much'...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: That's all?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: That's... pretty much it.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Bean, you twat! Can't you understand the words coming out of your own damn mouth?! You made Susie think we were a charity case!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Rebuilding the Green Spark might not be Susie's idea, but it's her money paying for it! Did you have the cheek to mention wages to her too?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Lord no, I didn't mention any of the sort! What kind of shameless bastard d'you think I am?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Still not willing to admit it, are you? Look at how much of a frizzle she's in thanks to you!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Alright, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Apologies, Susie, and everyone else...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Apologies won't cut it! At least give the Green Spark some free work for a month!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Hear hear!
attributes.name: Infected District Workers

attributes.content: The Infected workers continue to make a fuss, though it's mostly in good-natured teasing.
Bitter Root glances at Susie. The infectious laughter transforms her sad and apologetic expression into one of joy and warmth.
Everyone, wait, I still think—
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Consider our minds made up, Susie. If you're still insisting on giving us money, we'd have to consider you and Bean in cahoots!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: But... I can't just let everyone work for free—
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Susie. Just leave that all aside for the moment.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: If you say so...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Then, James, could you help move this chair, mirror, and all the hairdressing equipment out of the store?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I mean, sure, but why...?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: I couldn't possibly take all this shampoo with me, so it's best I give everyone a haircut right now!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No offense, but I've been meaning to do something about your scruffy hairdos! I won't make you work for free, Mr. Bean, if you sit down nice and quiet, alright?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hahaha, sure, sure.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Aren't you letting him off too lightly?
attributes.name: Infected District Workers

attributes.content: Don't think you lot can get away either!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.text: We're terribly sorry for all the trouble we caused you. The shampoo factory chief might be a right bastard, but we're hardly any better. We nearly let you spend all your savings on rebuilding the Green Spark.
As for the wages you wouldn't stop bringing up before you left Caladon, we settled on a Columbian approach to the matter:
Since we 'invested our labor' in building the place, we'll take half the pub's income and split it among ourselves. How does that sound?
But for now, we'd like you to have the pub's first month of income. It's yours to do with as you will.
If you ever have the time, do visit Caladon again. Everyone misses you.
And our hair's getting rather long, too.
All the best, the Infected of Caladon
